subject: Re: [junit] Migrating JMock parameterized tests from Junit 3.8.1 to 4.5
msgSnippet: Thanks Nat. Calling it at the end of each test method or using an @After annotated method both seem to work fine. Is it a valid use case though, wanting to
messageBody:
Thanks Nat.

Calling it at the end of each test method or using an @After annotated
method both seem to work fine.

Is it a valid use case though, wanting to compose / mix runner
functionality? I don't have an immediate need for it myself now, but
anyone else hit something like that?

Cheers,

James

2008/11/7 Nat Pryce <nat.pryce@...>:
> 2008/11/7 James Abley <james.abley@...>:
>
>> JMock when used under JUnit 4.x uses @RunWith, and so does JUnit 4.x
>> Parameterized tests. It doesn't look like I can mix the two.
>
> JMock's runner is purely for convenience. All it does is call
> assertIsSatisfied() on the Mockery. You can use a different runner if
> you perform that call explicitly at the end of each test.
>
> --Nat
>
